text: - My name is Seth Markle,
and I'm a senior principal engineer.
I've been with AWS for 12 years.
I've been with Amazon for 16.

I started as a software
engineer in amazon.com.
(upbeat music)

In 2008, I transferred over
to Merchant Customer Service.

And about two months
after I transferred there,

my manager left, and so his
manager came to me and said,
would you like to be a manager yourself?
I said, sure, why not?
Let's give that a try.
And so I managed for two years.
I realized management wasn't for me,

and I made a transition back
into engineering in 2010,
and moved over to AWS then.

Most of my job is to help
others form mental models
around the problems that they're solving.
(upbeat music)
My biggest highlight in AWS?

It was the culmination
of a lot of projects

that all came together
to deliver consistency,
read after write consistency, for S3.
And the it's been such a popular, like,
sought after feature

and something that helps
our customers a lot,
and it was so difficult to build

that it was just a huge
highlight for my career.
So there are three things I think of
that really motivate me to stay.

The first and foremost
is that I really believe
in the product.

I think it's super
beneficial to our customers.
It helps them move faster.
Anywhere from really small startups
to really large enterprises.

I also work with some of
the brightest coworkers,

and I find myself learning
a ton from day to day.

And the last thing that
keeps me really motivated

is just the difficulty of
the problems that I work on.
They're just extraordinarily hard problems
at an extraordinarily large scale
that I find to be super interesting.
(upbeat music)
